name: When is Outsourcing a Bad Idea?
short_description: Despite carrying a negative connotation in some business and consumer circles, outsourcing certain processes has been proven to increase efficiency and lower costs. According to a 2010 analysis conducted by IBM investigating the business impact of outsourcing, companies who outsourced certain functions experienced 48% higher operating income growth and 64% higher EBT growth than non-outsourcing companies. Below are several examples of situations in which it is a good idea to keep work in-house.
summary: Despite carrying a negative connotation in some business and consumer
